description.narrative: 4185 STRENGTHENING THE NATIONAL SYSTEM OF PROTECTED AREAS IN EQUATORIAL GUINEA FOR THE EFFECTIVE CONSERVATION OF REPRESENTATIVE ECOSYSTEMS AND GLOBALLY SIGNIFICANT BIODIVERSITY
capital of a political entity
capital of a political entity

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

description.narrative: A Policy framework and Strategy for the management of PAs is developed
Number of revised policies and laws enactedadopted

comment.narrative:
EG National Biodiversity Policy framework is nonfunctional
Environmental sector laws are unclear and contradictory
No environmental sector coordinating body exists
EGs 20year national development plan is not carbon neutral

By 2011 a revised National Biodiversity Policy enacted that supports a role for NGOs and community organizations in biodiversity management
By 2012 a new environmental sector law clearly defines complementary roles and responsibilities for MdePyMA MdeAyB and INDEFOR
By 2011 an environmental sector coordinating body created staffed and budgeted
By 2012 EGs 20year national development plan revised to be carbon neutral

The project team reviewed all laws relating to environmental forestry and protected areas
The project team has carried out a study and has given the necessary recommendations to address the problem of scattered and contradictory legislation
the document produced by the project team has been high at the level of the Council of Ministers for its consideration in the month of June 2015

By 2011 a revised National Biodiversity Policy enacted that supports a role for NGOs and community organizations in biodiversity management
By 2012 a new environmental sector law clearly defines complementary roles and responsibilities for MdePyMA MdeAyB and INDEFOR
By 2011 an environmental sector coordinating body created staffed and budgeted
By 2012 EGs 20year national development plan revised to be carbon neutral

The project team reviewed all laws relating to environmental forestry and protected areas
The project team has carried out a study and has given the necessary recommendations to address the problem of scattered and contradictory legislation
the document produced by the project team has been high at the level of the Council of Ministers for its consideration in the month of June 2015

description.narrative: Change in amount of FONAMA and FONADEFO financial disbursements

comment.narrative: FONAMA and FONADEFO are nonfunctional
By 2012 FONAMA and FONADEFO are dispersing 50 of recurrent and operational costs of NSPA and biodiversity management including grants to Guinean conservation NGOs
At this point you are waiting for decisions at the level of the Government of the Republic of Equatorial Guinea referred to in the recommendations drawn up by the management of the project team

Since October incorporation of the CTS 2014 to date have been held 6 seminars for training and capacitybuilding of technicians Rangers ecoguardas and volunteers
More than 65 people have improved their capacities for management guardianship and custody of protected areas Both of which are target of the project4 and the rest of protected areas9 of Equatorial Guinea
Is relevant the Symposium about the future of protected areas from the island of Bioko held on 11 and 12 June in which more than 90 people politicians municipal regional officials as well as members of civil society received information on actions to follow the project elaboration of natural resource management plans elaboration of plans of management and use of the two protected areas of the island of Bioko

description.narrative: Sustainable PA management approaches demonstrated in 3 pilot sites
Percent of crop damage that is mitigated

comment.narrative: Crop damage from wild animals is unmanaged and unmitigated
By 2012 a quantitative survey of credible wild crop damage exists and a plan for appropriate mitigation prepared and submitted to the GoEG
No progress

description.narrative: Existence of MdePyMA field management unit for the Bioko Forest Corridor

comment.narrative: No management authority has an effective presence on Bioko Island
By 2012 MdePyMA has established a 5person field management unit assigned to the Bioko Forest Corridor
In progress

description.narrative: Existence of ecotourism business plan

comment.narrative: No organized profitable ecotourism exists based on Bioko Islands rare and endangered primates and birds
By 2012 a business plan for primate and birdfocused ecotourism on Bioko exists
in drafting the guiding document for the national strategy for green tourism in Guinea EcuatorialEn collaboration with the Ministry of tourism and the private sector and civil society agencies

description.narrative: Number of new or revised management plans

comment.narrative: Recent management plans exist only for Monte Alen and Río Campo There are no management plans for the Monte AlenRío Muní landscape or for the Caldera de LubaPico Basilé landscape
By 2010 updated management plans exist for Monte Alen Río Muní Caldera de Luba Pico Basilé and Río Campo

description.narrative: Gazetting of the Bioko Forest Corridor

comment.narrative: The critical ecological transect between the Caldera de Luba and Pico Basilé and the wild animals moving between the two are unprotected unmanaged and vulnerable to forest conversion
By 2012 the Bioko Forest Corridor is gazetted
